page.title: 07CLUBS
page.content: Llanynys Parish aquired an area of farmland for use as sports fields in the mid-sixties.There now exist soccer & cricket pitches as well as a play area for children and a modern pavilion which houses the local 9-18 Youth-Club.Rhewl F.C. competes in the Summer League since many players play for town clubs in the winter within the N.Wales League. The school is used for Evening Classes and P.T.A.activities e.g.Whist Drives and Fairs/Concerts. There exists a Womens Institute also. Social activity takes place mainly under the auspices of the sports clubs,local pub,school and church/chapel.Others are catered for in the towns.
